thread.title: Boys Basketball: Nevis, Menahga suffer losses
thread.title_full: Boys Basketball: Nevis, Menahga suffer losses

author: Vance Carlson
title: Boys Basketball: Nevis, Menahga suffer losses
text:
Boys Basketball: Nevis, Menahga suffer losses
Pequot Lakes edges the Tigers while Frazee defeats the Braves.
PEQUOT LAKES – Harrison Kennen (21) and Tollef Birkeland (17) combined to score 38 points in leading Pequot Lakes to a 62-61 boys basketball victory over Nevis on Tuesday, Jan. 28.
Alex Lester’s 28 points and nine rebounds and AJ Bessler’s 19 points and eight rebounds led the Tigers, who held a 28-24 advantage at the half. Isaac Bessler added 9 points with Devan Lindow leading the way with nine assists while grabbing five rebounds. Lester had five assists and joined AJ Bessler (who had three assists) with three steals.
ADVERTISEMENT
Pequot Lakes improved to 13-3 while ending Nevis’ eight-game winning streak. The Tigers fell to 12-3.
“This was a very good basketball game from start to finish. After we got an early lead, Pequot Lakes went to zone and the game was within a couple of possessions the rest of the way,” said Nevis head coach Scott Kramer. “We had chances to escape with the win, but we didn’t convert on a few plays and they were able to get to the free throw line late in the game. It was really good for us to have to compete on each possession down the stretch. It will make us better down the stretch and during tournament time.”
NEVIS: D. Lindow 2, I. Bessler 9, Buckholtz 3, Lester 28, AJ Bessler 19.
PEQUOT LAKES: Quale 3, Kennen 21, Dornseif 5, Lundgren 7, Birkeland 17, Krueger 4, Holubar 5.
Halftime: Nevis 28, Pequot Lakes 24.
Frazee defeats Braves
FRAZEE – Frazee used a 22-0 run in the first half to spark a 93-48 win over the Menahga boys basketball team on Tuesday, Jan. 28.
Roman Howard scored off a rebound, Garrett Tolkkinen hit a 3-pointer and Gavin Schreiber hit a jumper as the Braves had a 7-6 lead. Frazee responded for a 28-7 advantage while a 3-pointer by Matthew Treinen and a three-point play and a layup by Jonas Lusti paced the way for Menahga the rest of the half as the Hornets built a 51-23 lead.
ADVERTISEMENT
Two 3-pointers by Tolkkinen and 3-pointers by Day, Howard and Bret Pietila led the Braves in the second half.
Tolkkinen (9), Day (7) and Howard (7) combined for 23 points for the Braves, who made 7 of 16 3-pointers while turning the ball over 32 times. Howard had five rebounds and Tolkkinen dished out three assists as Menahga’s record fell to 1-16.
Asher Blaine’s 25 points, Carter Sonnenberg’s 16 points, and Adam Vigen’s 13 points and 10 assists led the Hornets, who made 10 of 25 3-pointers in improving to 8-9.
MENAHGA: Day 2 2-2 7, Lusti 2 2-5 6, Tolkkinen 3 0-2 9, Howard 3 0-0 7, Schreiber 2 2-2 6, Treinen 2 0-0 5, Roth 0 0-0 0, Brad Pietila 0 2-3 2, Bret Pietila 1 3-4 6, Andersen 0 0-0 0, Skoog 0 0-0 0, Weaver 0 0-0 0. Totals: 15 for 36 (FG), 11 for 18 (FT).
FRAZEE: Vigen 5 0-0 13, Kilde 1 0-0 3, Reierson 1 2-2 4, Grossman 0 1-2 1, Lyman 1 0-0 2, Weldon 2 2-4 7, Sonnenberg 6 4-7 16, Aho 1 2-2 4, Mekalson 6 0-0 12, Blaine 8 4-6 25, Erickson 1 0-0 2, Mickelson 1 2-2 4. Totals: 33 for 73 (FG), 17 for 25 (FT).
Halftime: Frazee 51, Menahga 23. Three-pointers: Day 1, Tolkkinen 3, Howard 1, Treinen 1, Vigen 3, Kilde 1, Weldon 1, Blaine 5. Team fouls: Menahga 14, Frazee 13. Rebounds: Menahga 18 (Howard 5, Schreiber 4, Day 3, Skoog 2, Bret Pietila 2, Lusti 1, Tolkkinen 1). Assists: Menahga 8 (Tokkinen 3, Day 1, Lusti 1, Howard 1, Treinen 1, Schreiber 1). Steals: Menahga 5 (Day 2, Howard 1, Tolkkinen 1, Weaver 1). Blocked shots: Menahga 6 (Lusti 2, Day 1, Treinen 1, Schreiber 1, Skoog 1). Turnovers: Menahga 32, Frazee 12.
